comments.text: I couldn't find the requirement for Python 3.5 clearly listed anywhere in the "Adding Glean to Your Project" section of the docs.  It is there in the developing for the Glean SDK section, but not for the consuming Glean docs.  This is especially important for MacOS, which currently ships with a version of Python at 2.7.  We should call out the same instructions for working on Glean in the working with Glean part of the docs.
comments.creator: tlong@mozilla.com
comments.author: tlong@mozilla.com

comments.text:
For Android, the Glean Gradle plugin installs Python on the user's behalf (which is why the docs are silent on that).

For iOS, we could work out something similar, or just document -- kinda depends on relative effort.  For Android, we needed to support Windows dev machines which would have been a pain.  For iOS, we only need to support Mac where there are many easy options to install Python 3.
comments.creator: mdroettboom@mozilla.com
